author: archyde
title: Saudia Group signs largest global order to purchase 100 electric aircraft
text:
German company Lilium is the developer of the world’s first fully electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft. The Lilium aircraft features large cabins that can accommodate up to six guests plus luggage.
Agreement signing ceremony
The deal follows a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between the two parties in October 2022, which marks an industry milestone as the largest firm order for eVTOL aircraft. The agreement includes a timeline for aircraft deliveries, performance guarantees, comprehensive fleet maintenance and support services. In addition, the two parties intend to sign a “Lilium POWER ON” agreement that will include fleet maintenance and support services.
With its leadership, the Saudi Group will be the first company in the Middle East and North Africa region to own fully electric eVTOL aircraft, reflecting our commitment to implementing initiatives that support sustainable aviation in line with the goals of Saudi Vision 2030 in this field.
Electric aircraft provide new routes for transporting guests with the advantage of being able to take off and land vertically, covering a distance of up to 175 kilometers at a speed of up to 250 kilometers per hour, thus saving guests’ time by approximately 90% compared to other transportation options and representing a solution to the challenge of congestion. They serve the business and exhibitions sector to facilitate the transportation of guests to attend and participate in these events. They also provide a qualitative option for tourist destinations as well as sports and entertainment events, while at the same time connecting the guests of God to Makkah Al-Mukarramah and the holy sites. In addition, they are environmentally friendly, making them one of the enablers of sustainable air travel.
The Saudi Group will receive the first aircraft in 2026, where its operation will be approved according to the regulations that ensure safety and quality by the General Authority of Civil Aviation in the Kingdom, while its operations will be operated and managed by the Saudi Private Aviation Company.
Source: RT
#Saudia #Group #signs #largest #global #order #purchase #electric #aircraft

author: beatriceco
title: Thailand Turns to Mobile Data to Revitalise Tourism Industry with 'Routes to Roots' Initiative
text:
This post was originally published on here
Assistant Professor Dr Nattapong Punnoi from Chulalongkorn University’s Social Design Lab cited Japan’s Setouchi Islands as inspiration, where mobility data helped transform a deserted fishing community into a contemporary art destination.
“This cluster-based tourism strategy enables all stakeholders to see the industry through a new lens,” he said.
During a panel discussion entitled “Thailand’s Tourism Industry Future: Challenges and Opportunities,” industry experts outlined the strategic shift in thinking.
Watcharee Churugsa from the Designated Areas for Sustainable Tourism Administration noted that Thailand’s previous approach had been overly focused on demand generation whilst neglecting supply-side considerations.
“Thailand previously focused on marketing to promote the country in order to attract more tourists. However, we disregard the supply side, resulting in overtourism,” she explained.
She stressed that leveraging mobility data through partnerships between technology, private sector, and civil society could improve tourism in terms of “inclusion, sustainability, and economic benefit to the local community as well as community wellness.”
The government is also exploring medical tourism opportunities, with Dr Komgrit encouraging collaboration around the Whole Genome Sequencing Centre to create personalised tourism experiences.
He advocated for creating “a single large medical tourism platform that made extensive use of the Whole Genome Sequencing Centre,” emphasising that genomic data could help capture niche markets and personalise tourist preferences for both Thai and international visitors.
“With a platform that supports authenticating data, you can undoubtedly bring value to the Thai tourism business, such as medical, wellness, and spa,” Dr Komgrit explained. “This would allow us to standardise and certify our tourism services to a higher level, and the connected firms that can be included on the platform will be the standard and trusted ones.”
Assistant Professor Supawadee Phothiyarach , Senior Expert at NXPO, reinforced the importance of translating research into practical business applications.
She highlighted that data-driven approaches could help Thailand advance “in becoming a tourism destination for all, including both demand and supply sides.”
Two additional routes are scheduled to launch soon as part of The Cloud Journey: Routes to Roots initiative , with detailed information available through The Cloud platform.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing
Economy, Business and Finance->tourism and leisure industry

author: Redacció
title: Un estudi revela la relaci\u00f3 entre caf\u00e8 i colesterol
text:
El cafè té moltes propietats beneficioses per a la salut de les persones. De fet, s'ha guanyat al llarg dels anys bona part de l'aval científic. Entre d'altres, perquè s'ha demostrat que és eficaç en la prevenció de malalties hepàtiques i en la reducció de la possibilitat de patir molts tipus de càncer, entre d'altres. No obstant això, una altra història diferent és el cafè descafeïnat.
Ho revela l'estudi del Centre del Cor Fuqua i el Centre per a la Salut i Aprenentatge Piedmonton-Mercer, que ha trobat que aquest tipus de cafè pot fer créixer el colesterol. La investigació es va desenvolupar durant tres mesos en els quals es va dividir la població en tres grups. El primer, prenia entre tres i sis tasses de descafeïnat al dia. El segon, les mateixes tasses, però de cafè normal. I el darrer que, directament, no prenia absolutament res. Què van trobar?
Els resultats diuen que el grup que bevia descafeïnat va tenir un augment d'àcids grassos del 8%, un índex que es vincula amb el risc de patir malaltia cardiovascular i colesterol. A més a més, el total de greix en sang també va augmentar. Un 18% per ser exactes. Com ho van detectar? Doncs relacionant amb l'Índex de Massa Corporal (IMC) dels participants en la recerca, que va augmentar un 80% en aquells que tenien un índex superior a 25 i en un 30 en qui estava en un índex saludable. En canvi, a l'altra cara de la moneda, res es va alterar en els altres dos grups.
Més enllà d'aquest estudi, un altre del British Journal of Nutrition va trobar que també hi ha una certa relació entre la reducció del risc de tenir diabetis del tipus 2 i la ingesta de cafè descafeïnat. Exactament, el mateix que passa amb el cafè normal, perquè podria tenir més sensibilitat a la insulina i regular els nivells de glucosa en sang.

author: /cronologia/-/meta/elvis-mendoza
title: A la espera de las fuertes lluvias para llenar las represas
text: TEGUCIGALPA, HONDURAS.- Nueve días de mayo han pasado y solo una pequeña y fugaz lluvia se ha reportado, sin embargo, la misma no fue suficiente para bajar las temperaturas, mucho menos para dar un pequeño porcentaje de agua a las represas de la capital. El embalse La Concepción tiene el 43% de su capacidad, que representan 15.8 millones de metros cúbicos de agua, de los 46.2 millones que se necesitan para rebosar. La que tiene un nivel bajo es la represa Los Laureles, ya que alcanza el 35%, esto es tan sólo 3.7 millones de metros cúbicos de agua. Sumado, ambos estanques solo tienen 19.5 mmc. A la espera de lluvias Se necesitan lluvias constantes sobre la zona sur de la ciudad, donde está la cuenca de ambas represas, para que comiencen a recuperar sus niveles. Son al menos dos semanas de lluvia diarias en la zona alta de los ríos para que alimenten a cada embalse. Según los pronósticos del Centro de Estudios Atmosféricos, Oceanográficos y Sísmicos (Cenaos), hasta la segunda mitad de mayo se comenzarán a reportar lluvias con mayor frecuencia en la ciudad. Pero estas no serán capaces de aumentar de forma considerable los embalses. Se estima que será hasta la segunda mitad del invierno que Los Laureles llegue a su nivel máximo y se mantiene a la expectativa de si La Concepción alcanzará el 100%.
